= IDE integration =

== FlashDevelop ==

=== Syntax highlight ===

To enable Syntax highlighting in Flashdevelop we need to edit two files.

  * C:\Dokumente und Einstellungen\[USER]\Lokale Einstellungen\Anwendungsdaten\FlashDevelop\Settings\Languages\GSC.xml
  * C:\[APPLICATION FOLDER]\FlashDevelop\Settings\ScintillaNET.xml
  * C:\[APPLICATION FOLDER]\FlashDevelop\Settings}MainMenu.xml

Download the file SYNTAX_FLASHDEVELOP.XML and save it in the folder:

C:\Dokumente und Einstellungen\[USER]\Lokale Einstellungen\Anwendungsdaten\FlashDevelop\Settings\Languages\

Rename the file to GSC.xml.


*MainMenu.xml*

Add this line directly under the line {{{<menu label="Label.Syntax" name="SyntaxMenu">}}}

{{{
<button label="&amp;gsc" click="ChangeSyntax" tag="gsc" flags="Enable:IsEditable+Check:IsEditable|IsActiveSyntax" />
}}}

The file should now look like this:

{{{
...
	<menu label="Label.Syntax" name="SyntaxMenu">
		<button label="&amp;gsc" click="ChangeSyntax" tag="gsc" flags="Enable:IsEditable+Check:IsEditable|IsActiveSyntax" />
		<button label="&amp;AS2" click="ChangeSyntax" tag="as2" flags="Enable:IsEditable+Check:IsEditable|IsActiveSyntax" />
...
}}}



*ScintillaNET.xml*

Add the following line to the file directly above the </includes> tag.
{{{
    <include file="$(BaseDir)\Settings\Languages\gsc.xml" />
}}}

The last lines of the file should now look like this:
{{{
...
    <include file="$(BaseDir)\Settings\Languages\gsc.xml" />
  </includes>
</Scintilla>
}}}

Save the file and close it.
